title: fragment/analytics/utm_parameters
description: Standard fields for campaign attribution in product analytics, using industry-standard Urchin Tracking Module (UTM) parameters

utm_source.description:
Identifies which site or app sent the traffic, and is a *required parameter*; for example: "Wikipedia", "Twitter", "Facebook"
MediaWiki-based instrumentation can assign the value of this field by retrieving it with `mw.util.getParamValue( 'utm_source' )`

utm_medium.description:
Identifies what type of link was used such as "socialmedia" or "email"
MediaWiki-based instrumentation can assign the value of this field by retrieving it with `mw.util.getParamValue( 'utm_medium' )`

utm_campaign.description:
Identifies a specific product promotion or strategic campaign; for example: "app_marketing_20200704" or "india_awareness_2017"
MediaWiki-based instrumentation can assign the value of this field by retrieving it with `mw.util.getParamValue( 'utm_campaign' )`

utm_term.description:
Identifies search terms (e.g. "mobile+app")
MediaWiki-based instrumentation can assign the value of this field by retrieving it with `mw.util.getParamValue( 'utm_term' )`

utm_content.description:
Identifies what specifically was clicked to bring the user to the site, such as a banner ad, a text link, or a sidebar button. It is often used for A/B testing and content-targeted ads.
MediaWiki-based instrumentation can assign the value of this field by retrieving it with `mw.util.getParamValue( 'utm_content' )`
